ISSUE.TITLE: flowable-spring-boot-sample-jpa broken in 6.4.1
ISSUE.DESCRIPTION: When trying to run flowable-spring-boot-sample-jpa app, I am getting following error. > Parameter 2 of constructor in flowable.PhotoService required a bean named 'entityManagerFactory' that could not be found. Action: Consider defining a bean named 'entityManagerFactory' in your configuration. [WARNING] ``` java.lang.reflect.InvocationTargetException at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke0(Native Method) at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(NativeMethodAccessorImpl.java:62) at sun.reflect.DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.java:43) at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Method.java:498) at org.springframework.boot.maven.AbstractRunMojo$LaunchRunner.run(AbstractRunMojo.java:558) at java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:745) Caused by: dependency expressed through constructor parameter 2; nested exception is org.springframework.beans.factory.BeanCreationException: Error creating bean with name 'photoRepository': Cannot create inner argument; nested exception is org.springframework.beans.factory.NoSuchBeanDefinitionException: No bean named 'entityManagerFactory' available at BUGGYCOMMIT.MESSAGE: Add support for skip expression in email tasks

COMMIT.MESSAGE: Hibernate should not be a test dependency in the root dependency management If hibernate is needed for tests then it should be defined with a test scope in the appropriate pom.xml. Fixes #1776
Hibernate should not be a test dependency in the root dependency management If hibernate is needed for tests then it should be defined with a test scope in the appropriate pom.xml. Fixes #1776
